Package spring2024.cs472.hotelwebsite.controllers

Class LoginController

java.lang.Object
spring2024.cs472.hotelwebsite.controllers.LoginController
@Controller public class LoginController extends Object
This class handles user authentication, login, logout, and password reset functionality. It provides methods for displaying login page, processing login/logout, and handling forgot/reset password.
Author:
Team ABCFG

  • Method Details

    • loginPage

      @GetMapping("/login") public String loginPage(org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Displays the login page.
      Parameters:
      model - The Model object to add attributes for the view.
      session - The HttpSession object to check for existing guest/admin sessions.
      Returns:
      The view name for displaying the login page.

    • logout

      @GetMapping("/logout") public String logout(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Logs out the user.
      Parameters:
      session - The HttpSession object to remove guest/admin attributes.
      Returns:
      The view name for redirecting to the home page.

    • loginPage

      @PostMapping("/login") public String loginPage(@RequestParam String username, @RequestParam String password, org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Processes the login request.
      Parameters:
      username - The username entered by the user.
      password - The password entered by the user.
      model - The Model object to add attributes for the view.
      session - The HttpSession object to set guest/admin attributes.
      Returns:
      The view name for redirecting to the respective dashboard.

    • forgotPassword

      @GetMapping("/forgotPassword") public String forgotPassword()
      Displays the forgot password page.
      Returns:
      The view name for displaying the forgot password page.

    • forgotPassword

      @PostMapping("/forgotPassword") public String forgotPassword(@RequestParam String email, org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Processes the forgot password request.
      Parameters:
      email - The email entered by the user.
      model - The Model object to add attributes for the view.
      session - The HttpSession object to retrieve account information.
      Returns:
      The view name for redirecting based on the result of the operation.

    • resetPassword

      @GetMapping("/resetPassword/{token}") public String resetPassword(@PathVariable String token, org.springframework.ui.Model model, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpSession session)
      Displays the reset password page.
      Parameters:
      token - The reset token.
      model - The Model object to add attributes for the view.
      session - The HttpSession object to retrieve token information.
      Returns:
      The view name for displaying the reset password page or redirecting to error page.

    • resetPassword

      @PostMapping("/resetPassword/{token}") public String resetPassword(@PathVariable String token, @RequestParam String password, @RequestParam String email)
      Processes the reset password request.
      Parameters:
      token - The reset token.
      password - The new password entered by the user.
      email - The email associated with the account.
      Returns:
      The view name for redirecting to the login page.
